subject: Philosophy
title: Epicureanism: Pleasure Done Right
description: A micro-lesson that makes Epicureanism: Pleasure Done Right usable.

hook.text: Epicurus said the goal of life is pleasure. But his idea of pleasure would surprise you.

buildup.text: He didn't mean wild parties. He meant the absence of pain â€” physical and mental. Ataraxia: undisturbed peace.

discovery.text: The best pleasures are simple: friendship, conversation, bread, and water under the stars.

twist.text: Luxury creates dependency and anxiety. The more you want, the more you suffer when you lose it.

climax.text: Epicurus founded a commune called the Garden. It was open to women and slaves â€” radical for ancient Greece.

punchline.text: Real pleasure is simple. Desire less, enjoy more.

quiz.question: What did Epicurus mean by 'pleasure'?
options: The absence of pain and mental disturbance
